author: JOEL MARTIN
title: Lind-Ritzville seniors ready to face the world
text:
Lind-Ritzville seniors ready to face the world
RITZVILLE — The Lind-Ritzville Class of 2025 has made it.
“Today, we're walking across the stage in wizard hats, holding diplomas that prove we endured through it all: the chaos, the cramming and the laughter and all the growing pains that came with high school,” said salutatorian Temple Gefre.
Two by two, the 34 members of the Class of 2025 processed into the Gilson Gym on Saturday to the high school band’s strains of “Pomp and Circumstance.” As is LRHS custom, the procession was led by the junior class marshals, Zoe Galbreath and Beau Fode.
LRHS Principal Kevin Terris started by reading a list of accomplishments of members of the class of 2025. Some, like participating in Future Farmers of America or performing in the school band, were fairly general.
Others were very specific.
“If you finished in seventh place at the WIAA state track competition 200-meter run with a time of 22.79, please stand,” Terris said.
The class had nine valedictorians, of whom five spoke at the ceremony. Camden Shaver took the podium first.
“I wasn't going to do a speech here today until one of my closest friends said to me, ‘I've never seen a brown person on that stage in a long time,’” she said. “And as silly and bold as that sounds, it truly hit … Whether your skin is brown, yellow or purple, whether your hair doesn't ‘behave,’ your background is different, or your identity or expression doesn't match what people expect, you are not too much. You are more than enough.”
Emilia Klewin attended classes at Eastern Washington University and participated in ROTC there while finishing up at LRHS, an experience that brought some lessons home to her. Brody Boness’ high school years were marked with adversity through major sports injuries, he said, which taught him the value of perseverance. Alyssa Williams discussed overcoming her competitive nature to learn that comparison is the killer of joy, and Addy Colbert spoke of learning not to be so eager for the next stage of life that you miss out on the current one.
The Class of 2025, collectively, was awarded more than $1 million in scholarships, School Counselor Kayla Walker said. Additionally, a few students were singled out for special recognition. Fredy Granados-Lopez and Liz Cruz earned the Washington State Seal of Biliteracy in Spanish. Granados-Lopez also received The Harry P. Hayes Award. The Honor Cup went to Claire Wellsandt.
The guest speaker was former Gonzaga basketball star Mike Nilson, who spoke about the importance of commitment. Final words before the diplomas were awarded came from senior Brix Curtis, chosen by his peers to deliver the closing address. Curtis was not an especially distinguished student or an impressive athlete, he said, but his class’s achievements weren’t about those things.
“The best part about my class is that at their core, they're all good, kind people and to me, that is what matters,” he said. “As far back as I can remember, my class has always been in constant competition, not to be better than each other, but to better ourselves as a collective. We have nine valedictorians for a reason … We all did these things not to impress ourselves, but because we were all surrounded by impressive people, people who lift each other up and show each other it’s possible to do great things once again.”

author: VNExplorer
title: Hombre CONFIESA haber matado a su esposa e hijos en NAVIDAD porque escuchó voces
text:
Por haber escuchado voces, un padre de familia confiesa haber matado a sus cuatro hijos y a su esposa a puñaladas en Francia justo el día de Navidad.
El hombre de 33 años de edad fue detenido como sospechoso desde el día de Navidad cuando localizaron a las cinco víctimas en su domicilio de Meaux, a 40 kilómetros de París.
Los menores de edad de 10 y 7 años fueron encontrados con “una decena de puñaladas cada una” de acuerdo al fiscal de Meaux, Jean-Baptiste Bladier.
Las puñaladas, de acuerdo al fiscal, fueron “administradas con gran violencia”, mientras que los menores de edad de cuatro años y 9 meses murieron por asfixia por ahogamiento.
El hombre admitió que fue el responsable del multihomicidio y declaró que había “oído voces” pidiéndole “hacer daño”.
Foto: EFE
“Afirmó que acostumbraba tomar su tratamiento de medicamentos diario, al que estaba obligado en un marco no judicial desde 2019, pero que no lo hizo el 24 de diciembre pasado”, detalló el fiscal de la ciudad de Francia.
Cabe destacar que las víctimas fueron encontradas el día de Navidad, sin embargo, se desconoce cuándo fue la fecha exacta de la tragedia, pero la Nochebuena, los vecinos oyeron gritos, aunque no les dieron mayor importancia porque eran “habituales” en la casa.
Foto: EFE
Vecinos fueron quienes avisaron a las autoridades debido a no tener noticias de la madre de familia.
El hombre podría enfrentarse a cadena perpetúa por los delitos de homicidio voluntario de menores de quince años y el de homicidio voluntario del cónyuge.

author: @sandrarose
title: Chris Brown’s Favorite Meal is Vagina (Video)
text: Chris Brown says his favorite meal is vagina. The R&B singer endeared himself to women on Twitter/X after he made the comment during an interview in Paris. Brown is in France where he’s attending Paris Fashion Week events this week. He was asked to comment on styling tips, to which he responded “Be you, don’t worry about what other people look like. Try to look like yourself.” Then Brown was asked what’s his favorite meal. Chris Brown says his favorite meal is vagina. [pic.twitter.com/0PPImsX6D6] — Daily Loud (@DailyLoud) [January 24, 2024] “He’s so real for that,” one adoring fan wrote on Twitter/X. Another fan pointed out that rapper Lil Wayne also enjoys oral s*x. A third Twitter user wrote: “You are what you eat.” Every real man’s favorite meal is pxxxy ? Listen again [pic.twitter.com/WzIaU3SfVw] — TeeTalk ? (@obajemujnr) [January 24, 2024] While oral s*x is immensely enjoyable for men and women, doctors say it can [cause oral cancer](//www.webmd.com/oral-health/oral-hpv-cancer). Research shows a link between the human papillomavirus (HPV) and cancers of the mouth and throat. About 7% of Americans have oral HPV, while [genital HPV](//www.webmd.com/oral-health/oral-hpv-cancer) is the most common sexually transmitted disease in the U.S. The immune system fights the virus and most people don’t show symptoms. But if the immune system can’t fight the virus, it can cause cervical and oral cancers. Cancers usually develop in the throat, at the back of the roof of the mouth, or at the base of the tongue, according to [WebMD](https://www.webmd.com/oral-health/oral-hpv-cancer). You can be infected for 10 years or more before a cancer develops. Men are three times more likely to get cancer from HPV than women. The cancers are most common in people under age 60, especially those in their 30s and 40s.

author: Terri Dee
title: Indiana women get new start on college from behind bars
text:
Indiana women get new start on college from behind bars
Wednesday, June 4, 2025
By Claire Rafford for Mirror Indy.
Broadcast version by Terri Dee for Indiana News Service reporting for the Mirror Indy-Free Press Indiana-Public News Service Collaboration.
For Kaneka Kidd, college has very much been a family affair.
She started classes through Marian University’s program at the Indiana Women’s Prison at the same time her youngest daughter started college.
Kidd also called her grandkids often to tell them about the classes she was taking, to hopefully encourage them to attend college one day. It was important to her that her family knew she was learning while inside.
“Being incarcerated for so long, you have to have something to go home to,” Kidd, 46, said. “I wanted to be an encouragement to them, also.”
Kidd was one of six women to graduate May 16 with her associate of arts degree from Marian University. Through its Women’s College Partnership, Marian offers classes and degrees to women at the prison, including those who committed violent crimes.
Marian’s been offering classes at the women’s prison since 2019 in collaboration with the Bard Prison Initiative, a national organization that supports liberal arts programs for incarcerated students. Students take classes in a variety of subjects, including civics, art, literature and science.
If Courtney Kincaid had to pick a favorite class from her two-and-a-half years of Marian education, it would be the “inside-out” class this spring, where students from Marian’s main campus came to the prison to take the class alongside the incarcerated students.
In that class, there was no divide. Everyone learned together, and that meant the world to Kincaid.
“It pushed me to continue to empower other people that this degree is a statement for us to be able to be students,” Kincaid, 35, said. “Because in this program, that’s what we are. We’re students. We’re not seen for where we wake up every day.”
Kincaid has always wanted to go to college, but she said life got in the way. Though she studied at Huntington University in northern Indiana and Purdue Fort Wayne, the May 16 ceremony was her first-ever graduation. She was chosen by her classmates to be the commencement speaker.
After working toward that goal for so long, walking across the stage was surreal.
“I almost couldn’t believe it,” Kincaid said. “It was like an out-of-body experience, because I accomplished something I always wanted to do, and I didn’t think that I would have the opportunity in a location like this.”
Kincaid’s celebrating her degree, but her educational journey isn’t over. She’s already studying to earn her bachelor’s degree from Marian, and eventually hopes to get a master’s degree and become a social worker.
Kidd has similar ambitions. She knows firsthand how hard it is for women experiencing domestic violence to escape abusive relationships, and hopes to use her lived experience to help people like her through social work.
“I want to help someone, because I wasn’t able to get the help,” she said.
Claire Rafford wrote this article for Mirror Indy.

Alemania: "Casi toda Baja Sajonia bajo el agua"
dw.com
El servicio meteorológico de Alemania informó este viernes (29.12.2023) que se prevén más lluvias torrenciales en algunas zonas del país, como en Renania del Norte-Westfalia y la Baja Sajonia, afectadas ya durante varios días por graves inundaciones. "Tenemos una situación muy, muy tensa", dijo este viernes la Ministra de Interior de Baja Sajonia, Daniela Behrens (del Partido Socialdemócrata o SPD), en la radio Deutschlandfunk. "Casi toda la Baja Sajonia está bajo el agua", añadió Bahrens, por lo que se han desplegado cerca de 100.000 bomberos

author: STAFF REPORT
title: Timberlake FFA earns honors
text:
Timberlake FFA earns honors
Timberlake High School’s FFA team earned a first-place award at the Idaho FFA competition held at the University of Idaho.
Gabi Zentner, Pheiffer Rosenberger, Hayden Johnsen and Cody Routt formed the team that beat 52 others from across the state of Idaho. The teams judged nine classes of livestock, including sheep, cattle, goats and hogs.
The Timberlake students also distinguished themselves among the 198 individual entries. Johnsen placed second overall, while Zentner and Rosenberger placed ninth and 13th, respectively.
Timberlake FFA will represent Idaho at the 2026 national livestock judging contest held in Indianapolis.

author: dircom-noticias
title: Instituto Tecnológico de Santo Domingo - OSCaribbean is presented: an initiative to promote open science in the Dominican Republic and the Caribbean.
text:
Categories:
Publication date:
OSCaribbean launched: an initiative to promote open science in the Dominican Republic and the Caribbean
SANTO DOMINGO. – With the goal of strengthening Open Science in the Dominican Republic and the Caribbean region, the Open Science Caribbean (OSCaribbean) Foundation was launched. This initiative was conceived as part of the commitment of a group of professionals, academics, and scientists from various universities to the promotion, training, and development of open science through the integration, organization, and dissemination of high-impact scientific information.
OS Caribbean is positioned as a relevant player in the region, committed to scientific advancement and international collaboration, as well as strengthening joint initiatives among the countries in the region.
The foundation was founded with the mission of being a fundamental pillar in the promotion and dissemination of open access scientific knowledge through information and communications technologies (ICT), training programs, and the management of innovative projects that foster the construction of a research culture in the Caribbean region.
The vision of its members is to impact the entire Dominican Republic and the Caribbean region through Open Science, opening new scenarios for international collaboration to strengthen global science.
During the launching activity, held at the Social Security Auditorium (OSES) of the Instituto Tecnológico de Santo Domingo (INTEC), Julio Sánchez Maríñez, rector of that university, offered a welcoming address in which he highlighted the importance of initiatives like OSCaribbean in promoting the democratization of knowledge in the region.
Dr. Berniza Calderón, Vice President of OS Caribbean, was responsible for introducing the foundation's members. The team is chaired by Manuel Madé, PhD in Logic and Philosophy of Science, with extensive experience in digital transformation, bibliometrics, and data analysis; Calderón, as Vice President, contributes his expertise in medicine, endocrinology, and research management; and Dr. Elsi Jiménez, a specialist in education, information management, and library science, serves as General Secretary.
In the project area, the organization relies on the experience of Chantal Valdez, a project manager with a background in business management and strategy development. Additionally, Dr. Manuel Soto, project director, specializes in digital health, data analysis, and open source software.
The finance team is led by Sergio Castillo, an expert in strategic planning and financial resource management. In the area of innovation, Dr. Alba Beltre contributes her expertise in health policy and research management.
For technological development, OSCaribbean relies on Víctor Brito, a full-stack developer with experience in process automation and scalable systems. Finally, the inter-institutional relations area is led by Heidi Sánchez, a specialist in intellectual property, innovation, and technology transfer.
A clear vision for the future
Manuel Madé, president of OSCaribbean, offered a detailed presentation on the state of science in the Insular Caribbean, highlighting the challenges and opportunities the region faces in consolidating a more accessible, inclusive, and collaborative research ecosystem.
The event concluded with remarks from INTEC's Vice-Rector for Research and Outreach, Rosario Aróstegui, who reaffirmed the university's commitment to Open Science and encouraged those present to join this initiative.

author: financialcontent.com
title: All About Bail Bonds Redefines Felony Bail Bond Services in Austin and Houston, Texas | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Committed to providing swift and reliable solutions, All About Bail Bonds ensures that individuals facing felony charges can access the support they need during challenging times.
Houston, TX All About Bail Bonds is a trusted name in the bail bond industry, and they can arrange for bails in Austin and Houston, Texas in the short time possible. They also offer felony bail bond services, serving the communities of Austin and Houston, Texas.
All About Bail Bonds recognizes the unique challenges associated with felony charges. The company's felony bail bond services are designed to empower individuals by providing a pathway to freedom while they await their court proceedings. By offering a comprehensive range of bail bond services, All About Bail Bonds aims to ease the stress and financial burden often associated with felony charges.
Understanding the situation's urgency, All About Bail Bonds streamlines the bail bond process for felony charges. The company's team of experienced and professional bail bondsmen is available around the clock to facilitate a quick and efficient release. This expedited service ensures that individuals can spend minimal time in custody, allowing them to focus on preparing their defense.
All About Bail Bonds prioritizes transparency in its operations. The company provides clients a clear understanding of the bail bond process, including associated costs and legal obligations. By offering competitive and affordable rates for felony bail bonds, All About Bail Bonds strives to make its services accessible to individuals from all walks of life.
Felony charges can range from severe offenses to complex legal situations. All About Bail Bonds has tailored its services to address a broad spectrum of felony charges, ensuring that individuals have a reliable partner throughout the legal process. The company's commitment extends beyond securing a release; it is about providing support and guidance during a challenging chapter in a person's life.
All About Bail Bonds has earned a reputation as a trustworthy resource for individuals facing legal challenges. The company's felony bail bond services exemplify its dedication to upholding the rights and dignity of those navigating the complexities of the legal system.
Get the assistance of one of their expert bail bondsman in Harris County and Tomball, Texas to get help with posting bail.
Call 713-676-2227, 832-859-6062, or 936-703-5050 (Montgomery County) for details.
About All About Bail Bonds
All About Bail Bonds is a prominent player in the bail bond industry, serving Austin and Houston, TX, with comprehensive bail bond services. With a commitment to excellence and client satisfaction, the company has been a reliable partner for individuals in need for years.

author: Alejandra Olmos
title: Los 4 signos que ganarán mucho dinero por tránsito de la Luna en Piscis del 19 al 21 de septiembre - Terra México
text: Signos del zodiaco Los 4 signos que ganarán mucho dinero por tránsito de la Luna en Piscis del 19 al 21 de septiembreLa energía de la Luna en Piscis es profundamente intuitiva, sensible y conectada con el plano emocional y espiritual. Favorece la creatividad, empatía e inspiración para hacer realidad los sueños más profundos. Del 19 al 21 de septiembre, el tránsito de la Luna en Piscis traerá energías positivas y oportunidades económicas para ciertos signos del zodiaco. Durante este periodo, algunos de estos signos se verán especialmente favorecidos, logrando un impulso en sus finanzas y, posiblemente, ganarán mucho dinero gracias a la influencia de este tránsito lunar. Esta Luna en dicho signo de agua fomenta la intuición, la creatividad y la manifestación de abundancia, lo que beneficiará a quienes estén más alineados con estas energías. Signos que ganarán mucho dinero por tránsito de la Luna en Piscis del 19 al 21 de septiembre - Tauro Se beneficiará del tránsito de la Luna en Piscis al ver cómo su enfoque práctico y su naturaleza perseverante se alinean con nuevas oportunidades financieras. Durante estos días, Tauro estará más conectado con su intuición, lo que le permitirá tomar decisiones acertadas que impulsarán sus ingresos. Este signo del zodiaco puede esperar ganar mucho dinero si sigue su instinto. - Cáncer Al ser un signo fuertemente influenciado por la Luna, experimentará un periodo de abundancia financiera durante este tránsito en Piscis. Del 19 al 21 de septiembre, los movimientos astrales favorecen a Cáncer, permitiéndole ganar mucho dinero y mejorar su estabilidad económica. - Escorpio Verá un aumento en su flujo de ingresos durante este tránsito de la Luna en Piscis, ya que su intensidad emocional y su capacidad de transformación se alinean perfectamente con la energía espiritual de este periodo. Su habilidad para profundizar en los detalles y aprovechar oportunidades ocultas le permitirá ganar mucho dinero entre el 19 y el 21 de septiembre, especialmente en inversiones o proyectos de alto riesgo. - Piscis Siendo el signo anfitrión de este tránsito lunar, disfrutará de una conexión aún más fuerte con la abundancia y las oportunidades económicas. Su intuición estará en su punto más alto, guiándolo hacia decisiones financieras exitosas y colaboraciones beneficiosas. Piscis tendrá una ventana de prosperidad en estos días, donde no solo ganará mucho dinero, sino que también sentirá que está en perfecta armonía con el universo.
